info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 12:58AM CDT until March 31 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR BUTLER...CRENSHAW...EASTERN ESCAMBIA...SOUTHEASTERN CONECUH AND COVINGTON COUNTIES... At 1258 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Logan to 6 miles southeast of Riverview, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Andalusia, Greenville, Brewton, Luverne, East Brewton, Georgiana, Brantley, McKenzie, River Falls, Red Level, Rutledge, Dozier, Heath, Gantt, Glenwood, Riverview, Petrey and Highland Home. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central Alabama...and northwestern Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
